text:
1. Not exactly, I think you can use list subscriptions however to work around that(just apply the list subscription anytime you apply the contact property.)
2. regarding writing to it, the only way to do it is through a HubSpot form. You can use query parameters to fill in fields in a form however.
So any updates on Developer Day 2018? We're starting to plan for inbound over here and was curious if there was any agenda for the developer day or anything about it at all?
Aaaanndddd just found the <#CBF8XQ57U|> channel.
does anyone know why HubSpot does not allow you to to connect a root domain?
i have a blog at <http://blog.aboutoliveoil.org|blog.aboutoliveoil.org>
and i want to change the url to just <http://aboutoliveoil.org|aboutoliveoil.org>
and support just told me that i have to buy the website add on, make it <http://www.aboutoliveoil.org|www.aboutoliveoil.org> and that i cant connect the root domain
is that right?
that's correct, HubSpot routes all their web-based services (website pages, landing pages, blogs, etc...) via CNAME DNS records, which to my knowledge cannot be assigned directly to a root record.
thanks mark. do you know why i have to buy website add on to host my blog on a www domain. is that right?
Anyone else getting this annoying issue? <https://spin.d.pr/iokMKU+>
Thanks, Jon.  That is what I was afraid of.
You may be able to write some properties using a workflow now that I think of it

but your portal has to have that feature.

I’m not crazy familiar with workflows so it’s just a guess.
Oh my… that looks incredibly frustrating
yea it’s obnoxious
You can put your blog on your <http://www.yourdomain.com|www.yourdomain.com> domain - you just have to connect it and point the CNAME to HubSpot’s address
but the root (no www.) would have to be redirected to the <http://www.yourdomain.com|www.yourdomain.com> domain
from the DNS settings
If you look here (in the yellow highlight) you’ll see what I’m describing <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/getting-started-with-HubSpot/how-to-take-your-content-live-with-HubSpot>
Same thing is happening to me. It’s been happening since Friday.

haha - there are details about Dev Day in that channel... more to some this week I believe.

Hey <@U6ZL2UZJ8> sorry for the delay here. The 4th of July set my schedule off a bit. These are probably the best resources we have at the moment for this. We'll be building out a new page in the coming months to speak to this, but for now this is what we have. (the format of the pages might be a little out of date, but info within is up to date).
<https://www.HubSpot.com/products/faq/HubSpot-vs-wordpress-cms>
<https://www.HubSpot.com/products/uptime-security-speed>
If you remember which presentation at Partner Day you saw the WP/Drupal/HubSpot latency comparison, I'd be happy to try and hunt that down

I'm going to create a list of tools similar to this that HubSpot CMS Developers have created - I also have <@U7SL518D6>’s chrome extension.... if anyone else has tools/work arounds they love or have built... please DM me :slightly_smiling_face:
dude, needed that like two weeks ago.... although <@U7V9DQ31P> method worked really well too. EDIT: oops, thought it was for the other way around, HubSpot > XML. Either way, really cool project.

Anyone else experiencing this issue today?… FTP timeouts seem to be happening everywhere, from cURL command line calls to using a program like Transmit/CyberDuck taking extremely long to list directories or perform uploads. cURL calls fail 99% of the time, the programs take forever but usually get it done. We haven’t been having this problem until today.
<@U7B0H5NPN>
